Wait, I just came upon this. Does this mean EVE is actually getting an update for 1.0 in the future? I thought it was abandoned and that was why the only version out was still for 0.24.

Wait, I just came upon this. Does this mean EVE is actually getting an update for 1.0 in the future? I thought it was abandoned and that was why the only version out was still for 0.24.

Yes. Not abandoned. It is just so different from the last version I had to refactor pretty much everything. Started a new thread, and suspended the old method of doing things.

Yes. Not abandoned. It is just so different from the last version I had to refactor pretty much everything. Started a new thread, and suspended the old method of doing things.

Thanks for doing all this by the way. It must be a tremendous amount of work and KSP really would not be anywhere close to as good as it is if it were not for EVE.
I still use the old version with Astronomer's Interstellar pack. KSP looks like something out of 2001 without it.

I still use the old version with Astronomer's Interstellar pack. KSP looks like something out of 2001 without it.

I just wanted to post a potential remedy for the 'red glow' - the very red glow around the sun.

under atmosphereMaterial try these values for _SunsetColor:

_SunsetColor = 1,0.75,0.2,0.25

These values imitate the color of Earth's 'sun glow' (It is a color aptly named Sun Glow). It is close to that color anyway (original is a bit too yellow to me) - original values for Sun Glow are: vec3(1.0, 0.8, 0.2).

Result:

http://i.imgur.com/XY42ZuE.jpg

sorry to ask but, in what file does this line need to be changed? cause i have bean searching in the EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements folder and i could not find any config file to put these in, or are they in some sort of compiled file? (in that case, it would be awsome if you could share the change)

would be awsome if my sky would not be a giant red glow

EDIT: was looking in the wrong folder, needed boulderco folder! got it and thanks!

Just out of interest, are there any configs/packs for this? I know pingopete has his for RSS, but I was wondering if there were any for stock

Just out of interest, are there any configs/packs for this? I know pingopete has his for RSS, but I was wondering if there were any for stock

Not really, but you can use old assets from say AVP or KSPRC, but you have to translate the texture's configuration to the new config format. On a somewhat related note, the skyboxes, planet textures from this post really enhance stock: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/107471-1-0-4-TextureReplacer-2-4-8-%2813-8-2015%29?p=2002681&viewfull=1#post2002681

Download link doesn't seem to be working.

EDIT: I figured it out. Right-click -> save as.

Edited August 27, 2015 by theonegalen

Just out of interest, are there any configs/packs for this? I know pingopete has his for RSS, but I was wondering if there were any for stock

Proot is working on a new version of KSPRC making use of this and Scatterer. Looks gorgeous. Maybe you can get access to some pre-release builds if you ask nicely?

I've recently been fiddling around with AVP's config files and I'm beginning to discover how he created the scattering effects with atmosphere. Is there a way to take the old format of atmospheres and import them to WIP EVE? I'm really just curious as to how easy it will be to port my cloud pack to WIP EVE when the time comes.

It seems there is a conflict issue between EVE WIP and SCANSAT planetary overlays.

Scansat has the option to overlay directly on a planet the current state of the scanning (be it altimetry, resource, biome,etc, etc) ,but with this mod on top, it seems the scansat layer is overwritten...

EVE WIP However still works with Kethane hexagonal grid.

Let me know if you have trouble to reproduce, and I'll narrow down the mod list...

P.S: my config (KSP v1.0.4 64 bit linux + lots & lots of mods)

Download link doesn't seem to be working.

EDIT: I figured it out. Right-click -> save as.

Lad. That is all... Thanks mate!
